column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=1. Introduction

#Text=Globally , the residential sector is responsible for 20 % of the total energy consumption , and this is expected to increase by 10 % until 2040 due to the growth of population , economic development and improvement of living standards .
#Text=Many technologies have been developed and engaged to solve the energy efficiency problem of residential buildings .

#Text=In recent years , with the rapid development of information and communication technology ( ICT ) and smart grids , smart home technology ( SHT ) has become a promising measure to benefit home occupant ’s living environment and improve living quality .
#Text=One important category of SHT is smart home energy technology ( SHET ) , particularly aiming to provide energy management services or energy reduction measures to residents .

#Text=SHET includes integrated systems or isolated components to manage the demand side of a smart grid by monitoring and arranging the home electricity consumption and various smart home appliances .

#Text=SHET achieves its energy management goals in two ways : ( 1 ) providing residents with their energy consumption information , to help residents cultivate energy saving behaviors ; and ( 2 ) providing residents the ability to control the domestic appliances which can be scheduled or optimized via smart devices , so that they can utilize some electricity tariff policies to cut their energy bills .

#Text=Under the pressure of reducing the energy consumption of residential sector , several country governments have proposed various policies or strategies to promote the use of smart technology in home energy saving , such as the European Commission ’s “ Create technologies and services for smart homes that provide smart solutions to energy consumers ” and the Smart Hong Kong plan “ Promote and support households to utilize smart home mobile apps to monitor household energy consumption and set targets ” .
#Text=In Singapore , some households were selected to install a home energy management system ( HEMS ) in a collaboration between the government and Panasonic .
#Text=Lots of previous research has focused on the technical issues of smart home energy technology .

#Text=Karlin categorized the current SHET into three groups : user interfaces , including energy portal , in-home display , load monitor ; and smart hardware , including smart appliance , smart light , smart thermostat , smart plug/switch as well as software platforms , such as smart home/web service platform .
#Text=The energy-saving capacity of each category of SHET have been demonstrated by many studies .
#Text=Louis et al. focused their attention on the environmental impacts of home energy systems during their lifecycle , and pointed out the energy payback time would be 1.6 years .
#Text=Additionally , several researchers have worked on topics related to the adoption and diffusion of smart home energy technology .

#Text=Balta-Ozkan organized expert interviews and questionnaire surveys in European countries , and investigated social barriers to smart home technology diffusion , including fitting to lifestyles , public administration , interoperability , reliability , privacy , trust , and cost ; he also pointed out energy cost savings , improving quality of life , environment , and information transparency as the four main drivers of smart home market development .

#Text=In Singapore , Bhati analyzed the perceptions of households about the usage of smart energy technology , concluding that residents have high awareness of the energy efficiency and indoor comfort , but are also concerned about the problem of security and privacy .

#Text=Some articles have examined the factors determining the adoption intention of specific home energy technology such as energy efficient household appliances or home energy management systems in several different countries , including Korea , Malaysia , China and Pakistan .
#Text=However , the influential factors of adoption intention are highly affected by the regional culture or demographic situation .
#Text=When talking about China , it has a huge population of 1.4 billion , and the residential sector accounts for 30.6 % of the total primary energy consumption .
#Text=Currently , the penetration rate of smart home energy technology in China is only 1.4 % , lower than the global average level of 1.67 % .
#Text=What is more , the literature studying the adoption of SHET by Chinese urban residents is not adequate .
#Text=More endeavor will be needed to investigate residents ’ perceptions towards SHET and the factors affecting resident ’s adoption intention .
#Text=Bridging this research gap could provide support to policy decisions or market strategies to promote the adoption and diffusion of SHET in China .
